verses.text: 保羅把福音傳給外族人因此，我這為你們外族人的緣故，作了為基督耶穌被囚禁的保羅，為你們祈求──

words.note: Indicates object is acted upon
Lit. 'blessed news'
Lit. 'outside-race people'
Lit. 'outside-race people'

verses.text: 想必你們聽過　神恩惠的計劃，他為你們的緣故賜恩給我，

words.note: Capitalized when referring to the Christian God

verses.text: 藉著啟示使我可以知道這奧祕，就像我以前在信中略略提過的。

breakdown.m: to rely on, by means of

verses.text: 你們讀了，就可以知道我深深地明白基督的奧祕。
這奧祕在以前的世代並沒有讓世人知道，不像現在藉著聖靈啟示了聖使徒和先知那樣。

words.note: Emphasizes the negative that follows

breakdown.m: to rely on, by means of

words.note: Refers to the Holy Spirit as a divine person
Lit. 'holy sent-disciples'
Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'

verses.text: 這奧祕就是外族人在基督耶穌裡，藉著福音可以同作後嗣，同為一體，同蒙應許。

words.note: Lit. 'blessed news'

verses.text: 我作了福音的僕役，是照著　神的恩賜（「恩賜」或譯「恩賞」）；這恩賜是按著他大能的作為賜給我的。

words.note: The empty character is an honorific space used for divine names.

verses.text: 我本來比聖徒中最小的還小，　神還是賜給我這恩典，要我把基督那測不透的豐富傳給外族人，

words.note: The empty character is an honorific space used for divine names.

verses.text: 並且使眾人明白那奧祕的救世計劃是甚麼（這奧祕是歷代以來隱藏在創造萬有的　神裡面的），

words.note: Refers to God as creator of the universe.
The empty character is an honorific space used for divine names.
Finalizes the descriptive clause 'hidden in God who created all things'.

verses.text: 為了要使天上執政的和掌權的，現在藉著教會都可以知道　神各樣的智慧。

words.note: Refers to spiritual rulers or authorities.
Refers to spiritual rulers or authorities.
The empty character is an honorific space used for divine names.

verses.text: 這都是照著　神在我們主基督耶穌裡所成就的永恆的旨意。

words.note: A combined name, often used in biblical texts.
Often precedes a verb to form a nominalized phrase or indicate agency.
Often refers to God's will or a divine decree in religious texts.

verses.text: 我們因信基督，就在他裡面坦然無懼，滿有把握地進到　神面前。

words.note: Here 'by faith'.
An idiom emphasizing confidence and lack of fear.
Often used as an adjective phrase.
Connects an adverbial phrase to a verb.

verses.text: 因此，我懇求你們，不要因著我為你們所受的苦難而沮喪，這原是你們的光榮。
基督的愛多麼長闊高深因此，我在父面前屈膝，

words.note: An idiomatic phrase describing vastness, especially used for God's love.
Refers to God the Father.

verses.text: （天上地上所有的家族都是由他命名的，）

words.note: Used with 是...的 to emphasize the agent or manner.

verses.text: 求他按著他榮耀的豐盛，藉著他的靈，用大能使你們內在的人剛強起來，

words.note: Refers to the Holy Spirit in Christian contexts.
Verb complement indicating 'begin to' or 'rise up'.

verses.text: 使基督藉著你們的信，住在你們心裡，使你們既然在愛中扎根建基，
就能和眾聖徒一同領悟基督的愛是多麼的長闊高深，
並且知道他的愛是超過人所能理解的，使你們被充滿，得著　神的一切豐盛。

words.note: An ideographic space used to elevate 神 (God) for reverence.

verses.text: 願榮耀歸給　神，就是歸給那能照著運行在我們裡面的大能，充充足足地成就一切，超過我們所求所想的。

words.note: An ideographic space used to elevate 神 (God) for reverence.
An AABB idiom, emphasizing 'full' and 'sufficient'.

verses.text: 願榮耀在教會中和基督耶穌裡歸給他，直到萬代，永世無窮。阿們。

words.note: A core concept in biblical theology.
Refers to the Christian church.
Implies eternity or an extremely long duration.
A common biblical term for eternity.
Hebrew transliteration, meaning 'so be it' or 'truly'.
